articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States is preparing to evacuate its Iraqi embassy due to heightened security risks in the region, three U.S. and two Iraqi sources said on Wednesday while a U.S. official said military dependents could also leave Bahrain.
articles.title: US preparing to evacuate embassy in Iraq over security risks, sources say

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: Several U.S. cities braced for protests against President Donald Trump's sweeping immigration raids, as parts of the country's second largest city Los Angeles spent the night under curfew in an effort to quell five days of unrest.
articles.title: US cities brace for more protests as parts of Los Angeles placed under curfew

articles.author: Doina Chiacu, Alistair Smout
articles.description: They offered little sign of a durable resolution to longstanding trade tensions.
articles.title: US-China trade deal is 'done,' Trump says

articles.author: Jack Queen, Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A Manhattan jury found Harvey Weinstein guilty on a sex crimes charge on Wednesday in a retrial after a state appeals court last year overturned the former movie mogul's 2020 conviction.
articles.title: Former movie mogul Harvey Weinstein convicted of sex crime in New York retrial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he would be willing to extend a July 8 deadline for completing trade talks with countries before higher U.S. tariffs take effect, but did not believe that would be necessary.
articles.title: Trump: willing to extend July 8 deadline for trade talks, but not likely necessary

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: A nine-minute-long Russian drone attack on Ukraine's second largest city of Kharkiv in the middle of the night killed at least two people and injured 54, including five children, regional officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Intense Russian drone attack on Kharkiv kills 2, injures 54, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Trump administration cannot use U.S. foreign policy interests to justify its detention of Columbia University student and pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil, a judge ruled on Wednesday, but stopped short of ordering Khalil's immediate release.
articles.title: US foreign policy no basis to detain Columbia protester Khalil, judge rules

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said in a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that his country will always stand with Moscow, state media reported on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea will always stand with Russia, leader Kim tells Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S- and Israeli-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation accused Hamas militants of attacking a bus on Wednesday carrying Palestinians working with the organization, leading to at least five deaths and multiple injuries.
articles.title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation says Hamas attacked a bus of its workers, 5 dead

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration has launched a formal review of a defense pact worth hundreds of billions of dollars that former President Joe Biden made with Australia and the United Kingdom, allowing Australia to acquire conventionally armed nuclear submarines, a U.S. defense official told Reuters.
articles.title: Trump administration reviewing Biden-era submarine pact with Australia, UK
